io.requery.sql

Interface Platform

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Derby, Generic, H2, HSQL, MySQL, Oracle, PlatformDelegate, PostgresSQL, SQLite, SQLServer

    public interface Platform
    Defines platform/vendor specific SQL features.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMappings(Mapping mapping)
      Given the attribute and FieldType allows the platform to replace the storage type with a platform specific one.
      GeneratedColumnDefinition generatedColumnDefinition() 
      Generator<LimitedElement> limitGenerator() 
      Generator<OrderByElement> orderByGenerator() 
      boolean supportsAddingConstraint() 
      boolean supportsGeneratedColumnsInPrepareStatement() 
      boolean supportsGeneratedKeysInBatchUpdate() 
      boolean supportsIfExists() 
      boolean supportsInlineForeignKeyReference() 
      boolean supportsUpsert() 
      Generator<Map<Expression<?>,Object>> upsertGenerator() 
      VersionColumnDefinition versionColumnDefinition() 

    • Method Detail

      • addMappings

        void addMappings(Mapping mapping)
        Given the attribute and FieldType allows the platform to replace the storage type with a platform specific one. Substitution occurs both for table generation and entity property conversion.
        Parameters:
        mapping - mapping containing type information of what is being read or written.

      • supportsInlineForeignKeyReference

        boolean supportsInlineForeignKeyReference()
        Returns:
        false if the database requires foreign keys to be defined as columns in the create table statement. true if they can be inlined in one statement.

      • supportsAddingConstraint

        boolean supportsAddingConstraint()
        Returns:
        true if the database supports adding a constraint (e.g. foreign key) after the column is created (or if it requires it). In most DDL statements the column is created first and then the constraint is added.

      • supportsIfExists

        boolean supportsIfExists()
        Returns:
        true if the database supports the 'if exists' syntax in the create table/index, drop DDL statements.

      • supportsGeneratedColumnsInPrepareStatement

        boolean supportsGeneratedColumnsInPrepareStatement()
        Returns:
        true if the JDBC Connection.prepareStatement(String, String[]) method should be used to get the generated key set when inserting records.

      • supportsGeneratedKeysInBatchUpdate

        boolean supportsGeneratedKeysInBatchUpdate()
        Returns:
        true if the JDBC driver supports reading generated keys via Statement.getGeneratedKeys().

      • supportsUpsert

        boolean supportsUpsert()
        Returns:
        true if the platform supports an upsert (insert or update) operation either via merge or an alternate syntax that is defined in upsertGenerator()

      • generatedColumnDefinition

        GeneratedColumnDefinition generatedColumnDefinition()
        Returns:
        the type of generated key type DDL this database supports.

      • limitGenerator

        Generator<LimitedElement> limitGenerator()
        Returns:
        the limit generator for this database

      • upsertGenerator

        Generator<Map<Expression<?>,Object>> upsertGenerator()
        Returns:
        the upsert generator for this database

      • orderByGenerator

        Generator<OrderByElement> orderByGenerator()
        Returns:
        the order by generator for this database

      • versionColumnDefinition

        VersionColumnDefinition versionColumnDefinition()
        Returns:
        the type of version column this database supports.
